phrase.item: Betrothals, among us, are like this: for example, my father, along with an old man, takes yet another man with him.
If they believe the betrothal will happen, they bring a bit of fabric--enough for a dress--and a printed scarf and they set off to arrange the engagement.
When they arrive there with the father, or if not then with an uncle, they announce to the parents [of the girl] that they wish to arrange a betrothal.
If they agree, her other close relatives are called and also asked [for their consent].
In general, if the girl's parents agree, there is nothing much to ask the other relatives.
rost corrected to rozi
Then all the relatives give their consent.
One of them puts incense in the incense burner, and if there is an old man among them he recites prayers.
After the prayer, they put [more] incense and shake one another's hands; if it is [already] late, the people who came for the engagement will stay the night with the family.
They will show them hospitality and treat them with esteem and respect.
At that time they can discuss when to hold the wedding--in one month, six months, or a year.
The girl's parents will say: "Well, it is better after one year."
"Let our daughter stay for one more year in her father's house."
Three or four months after the betrothal, the man who is marrying off his son should take a dowry to the girl's uncle's house.
The dowry consists of one good skinned sheep and twenty-five meters of fabric, all of this is taken to the uncle.
When the uncle receives the dowry he begins to prepare for his niece's wedding.
He makes his niece a woolen rug, two blankets, a dress, a shawl, and many other small things.
When the man brings the dowry, after several days the dowry will be taken to the house of the girl's parents.
When the dowry is taken, they confirm the date of the wedding.
Three or four days before the wedding a man from the groom's houshold goes to notify the bride's household.
When he arrives he says to them: "So, the day after tomorrow the groom will get here around six o'clock."
"You must now prepare for her wedding ."

In the groom's house, the wedding is celebrated this way: this evening is the wedding preparation [sup], tomorrow until the evening are the wedding festivities, and the day after the groom goes [to fetch] the bride.
That night, he stays there [at her house]. The next morning, he returns to his own house.
That day also the wedding celebration lasts until evening.
The day of the sup, two children are sent to invite all the families of that village.
An older person goes to invite the neighboring villages.
Relatives from farther-off villages will have already been invited.
Around five o'clock on the day of the sup, they start making food that should be ready around eight or nine.
The day of the sup people arrive from the village.
In the past, only neighbors and relatives would come on the day of the sup to make preparations.
Nowadays many people come for sup.
The day before a wedding a male sheep must be slaughtered.
It is not permittd to slaugher a goat.
If anyone has died in the village [within the past] four months, then in order to celebrate the wedding, permission should be asked from the family of the deceased.
They invite [that family] to the wedding preparations.
Out of respect, they place four or five meters of cloth in front of them.
If they then give [their] permision, everything is in order.
Because the wedding is celebrated with happiness and joy, they give the man a tambourine.
He is supposed to play daf first before of everyone
The wedding starts from that time, singing is allowed, dancing is allowed and organizing other games is also allowed.
On the preparation day, usually people only sing and dance and give money to those singers and dancers,
If relatives of the married couple dance they don't get anything, they say "spirits will give you blessings" (those people who are no longer alive).
After sup the next day is wedding.
Until early evening, more women come to the wedding, men mostly come in the evening more.
On the day of wedding there will be the cutting of hair.
cutting hair will be held in a relative's house.
The groom will be given a bath in that relatives house, get clean, will be dressed new cloths and they lift him up in the air and take him to his relatives house where he is given a hair cut.

The groom will be wear under cloth first, then they will lift him up and bring him inside the house, they will shave his head and beard, put a red scarf on his neck, two people will hold him on the sides, one person will cut his hair, the singers will sing sartaroshoni (cutting hair time) song.
When the singers sing the song, they add and mix more songs to make it longer, in order that other people put more money in the scarf.
The more they get (money) the better it is for them.
When they finish shaving his head, they will dress him with his cloth, tie his turban
From that time he becomes a real king, he will be respected very much, the wishes of the groom should be obeyed.
After cutting hair, they will eat food and go to the wedding house.
In the evening when the food is served, they start singing and dancing, then they start the Mughal game (a cross-dressing game).
Mayilbozi is a type of game where a man will wear woman's clothing and another man will wear a turban.
The lady will be the Mughal and the man will be the king,
Two people will be the king's chamberlains.
The king's chamberlains are very strict.
the man dances with muyil (the man who is dressed as a woman) and sings a song.
Four or five singers sing the refrain.
When they sing for a while, the Mughal goes up to the platform and hugs any man there.
At that time the chamberain will appear,
First one chamberlain goes to the man with the Mughal next to him and says: "I am the king's chamberlain, I come to you that you should let the king's servant go".
The man says, "Take her and go."
The chamberlain says: "It's not possible take (her) like this."
I am not going to take the king's servant without clothes, give me what's appropriate and I will take her.
If the man shows little dissatisfaction, the chamberlain will make fun of him and hit him with his whip.
He takes his money and leaves.
The second chamberlain will do the same.
When the game is over the chamberlains collect the game money and split it between each other.
The same way they continue having fun till midnight, in some houses singing continues till the morning next day.
The next day the groom goes to get the bride.
Fifteen-eighteen people go to get the bride, five-six old men, five- six adults, singers, the groom's father and his companion.
The groom and his people will be stopped on the way many times.
When the groom's people give money they will open the road.
The groom's people used to ask for King's prayers before giving the money.
If they don't know the king's prayer they won't give money.
When they go to the bride's house they sing the song: " Our king is leaving"
when they get to the bride's village they sing this song: "Our king came, our king came".
The groom's people enter the bride's house singing: " The king entered the house, the king entered the house".
Before entering, a lady holds the door so that they give her something
Another lady before that brings a big bowl of milk with butter and gives it to the groom to drink.
After they enter the house.
The groom's people all sit on the guest's platform.
After their siting the singers sing: " Welcome our king, weclome our king".
After that they bring him sweets
The singers take a rest that time.
After that someone gets up and congratulates the bride and groom.
the groom will be taken to the bride's place to another platform of the house.
the chosen-father holds his "son" so that he doesn't sit right away.
at that moment women make the bride to stand that she doesn't sit right away.
about five to ten minutes they force each other to sit, at the end they have to sit both together, the bride and the groom.
If the bride's village is close to the groom's vikkage, the groom doesn't stay over night in the bride's house.
But if the bride's house is far drom the droom's house for about seventy-eighty kilometers, the groom stays over night in bride's house.
The next day the food will be ready.
After having food, they say good bye to each other , take the bride and leave.
singing the song: "the flower is taken away, the hyacinth flower is taken away"
When the groom reaches home, they congratulate him, sprikle flower on his right shoulder (ptik), make him sit on the round platform and open the throne from the right side.
Young girls stay with the bride and groom on the round platform. They bump their head to each other that they will also marry.
The broom's mother meets her daughter-in-law
she says: " the wealth of _____ for you, the wealth of the house is for you".
At that moment a stong woman takes a man's child and puts on her lap saying that may God gives you also a son.
The groom's companion stays with the groom on the round platform.
The groom chooses a man, as father role and a woman as mother role who stays next next to him during the wedding ceremony three- four months in advance.
One day before the wedding day, the chosen-father stays all the time with his chosen-son.
even if the groom goes to washroom the chosen-father goes with him.
the chosen-mother is the wife of the chosen-father.
If the chosen-father doesn't have wife, whenever he marries his wife will become mother-chosen
When the bride comes to the groom's house her face is covered
the chosen-father opens her face with rolling pin.
A lady comes with the bride, its called mother-milk
exept mother-mild there anther person comes with bride, its called ________
Mother-chosen the lady comes who washed the bride's hair in her house, it's callled head washing.
The head washing ceremony is before the groom comes to the bride's house.
they wash the bride's head, do braiding and will wear beautiful cloth.
Food is served in the head-washing ceremony and then they hold the bride in the air and bring her to her father's house (to walk on the ground is not allowed).
A man from the bride's relative goes with her as _________
When the groom people come till twelve midnight will be singing and dancing, after twelve all the men leave.
Only relatives who came from far distance, close relatives and neighbours stay in the wedding house.
then they also go to sleep.
Bed should be fixed for the bride and groom.
Bed will be fixed by those ladies who don't have any daughter but should have sons.
The bride and groom sleeps and the mother-chosen also sleeps next to them.
The next day ladies bring flour and sprinkkle on the bride and groom's shoulder (ptik)
Long time ago the bride and groom stayed in the throne for seven days, after seven days the chosen mother- father bring food to the groom house, open the throne (made of materal) and take them away.
